org.eclipse.dirigible.repository.db

Class DatabaseCollection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.dirigible.repository.db.DatabaseEntity
      • org.eclipse.dirigible.repository.db.DatabaseCollection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICollection, IEntity

    public class DatabaseCollection
extends DatabaseEntity
implements ICollection
    The file system based implementation of ICollection.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DatabaseCollection(DatabaseRepository repository, RepositoryPath path)
      Instantiates a new local collection.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public void create()
            throws RepositoryWriteException
        Description copied from interface: IEntity
        Forces this entity to be created at its current path.

        Whether the entity will be created as a resource or a collection depends on whether it is an instance of IResource or ICollection.

        Specified by:
        create in interface IEntity
        Throws:
        RepositoryWriteException - if for some reason a connection to the backend could not be achieved, or if an entity with this path already exists on the backend.

      • delete

        public void delete()
            throws RepositoryWriteException
        Description copied from interface: IEntity
        Removes this entity from the repository.

        If no such resource exists, this method does nothing.

        Specified by:
        delete in interface IEntity
        Throws:
        RepositoryWriteException - if for some reason a connection to the backend could not be achieved.

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(String path)
            throws RepositoryWriteException
        Description copied from interface: IEntity
        Moves this entity to a collection at the specified path.

        If this entity is of type ICollection, then all child entities are copied too.

        Specified by:
        moveTo in interface IEntity
        Parameters:
        path - the new location
        Throws:
        RepositoryWriteException - if for some reason a connection to the backend could not be achieved

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
                throws RepositoryReadException
        Description copied from interface: IEntity
        Returns whether this entity is empty.

        If the entity is a collection, implementations should check to see if it has any child entities.

        If the entity is a resource, implementations should check to see if it has any content.
        Note: Calling this method on a resource can be slow.

        Specified by:
        isEmpty in interface IEntity
        Returns:
        whether this entity is empty
        Throws:
        RepositoryReadException - if for some reason a connection to the backend could not be achieved.

                             throws RepositoryWriteException
        Description copied from interface: ICollection
        Creates a new collection with the specified name in this collection.

        The name should not contain any slashes.

        The change is persisted to the backend.

        Returns:

      • getCollection

        public ICollection getCollection(String name)
        Description copied from interface: ICollection
        Returns the collection with the specified name contained in this collection.

        The returned collection is just a representation. It may not exist on the backend.

        Specified by:
        getCollection in interface ICollection
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        an ICollection instance.
